Sub: Accidental firino in CISF: Regarding
Accidental firing incidents persist as a pressing concern despite the issuance of various
circulars dedicated to their prevention. The recurrence of such incidents raises questions about our
professional competence in weapon handling, signifying a serious issue.
2. 
During the DG's Monday Meeting on 06.11.2023, it was emphasized that accidental firing
remains a significant chaltenge. Year-to-date, there have been 08 reported cases of accidental firing,
compared to just 04 cases in the previous year. Unfortunately, this year has also witnessed the loss
of one personnel due to accidental firing. The DG (CISF) directed strict adherence to Standard
Operating Procedures (SOPs) and instructions related to the issuance, deposition, and handling of
arms and ammunition.
3. 
lt is crucial to note that most accidental firing cases have occurred in the Quarter Guard
during the issuance and deposition of arms and ammunition. Despite comprehensive instructions
and guidelines issued by FHQ and APS HQrs, the repeated instances of accidental flring are a cause
for serious concern. The instructions and circulars from FHQ on this matter are reiterated and
enclosed in Appendix-'A'.
4. 
lt is important to mention that identified areas requiring immediate attention to curb accidental
fi ring incidents include:
(i). Strict adherence to standard guidelines and SOPs during the issue and deposition of arms
and ammunition.
(ii). Monitoring and supervision by middle-level officers.
(iii). Rigorous adherence to the unit-level weapon training regime.
(iv). Prevention of overconfidence and hastiness among personnel.
(v). Display of relevant instructions in the Unit Kote.
(vi). Avoidance of fiddling with weapons while on duty.
5. 
ln this regard, all Zonal DlsG/AP (NZ, SZ, WZ and E&NE) and D|sG/CASO of Delhi, Mumbai,
Bangalore, Hyderabad, Kolkata and Chennai are requested to ensure implementation of the
directions as enumerated in Appendix-'A' by the ASGS under their jurisdiction positively
6. 
lG/APS-l & ll are also requested to accord importance to this aspect during their visit at the
airports under their respective jurisdiction.
7. 
This is issued with the approval of the Competent Authority.
